author: Steven T. Dennis, Saleha Mohsin
description: Donald Trump economic adviser Stephen Miran is on his way to joining the Federal Reserve board after a key Senate vote Monday.
title: Stephen Miran Nears Fed Post Confirmation After Key Senate Vote

author: Mario Parker, Lauren Dezenski
description: President Donald Trump approved a National Guard deployment to Memphis, expanding the federal government’s efforts to crack down on what he has cast as out-of-control crime in Democratic-run cities.
title: Trump Sends Troops to Memphis, Says Chicago ‘Probably Next’

author: Josh Wingrove, Mario Parker
description: President Donald Trump and Vice President JD Vance pledged to investigate left-leaning organizations following the killing of Charlie Kirk, amplifying efforts to memorialize the conservative activist and laying the groundwork for federally scrutinizing political opponents that some administration officials and supporters have blamed in part for his death.
title: Trump and JD Vance Vow to Probe Groups on the Left  After Kirk’s Death

author: Jef Feeley, Nicolle Yapur
description: Venezuelan representatives and bidders for its most valuable foreign asset are clashing in a US court on Monday, as a judge in Delaware starts a three-day sale hearing to decide who will take over the parent of Citgo Petroleum Corp.
title: Venezuela, Bidders Clash Over Citgo’s Value in Court Auction

author: Alicia Clanton
description: Ethan Penner, a trader who helped transform the way commercial properties are financed, launched a long-shot independent bid to become California’s next governor.
title: CMBS Pioneer Penner Launches Long-Shot Bid for California Governor

author: Nathan R Dean
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Monday, Bloomberg Intelligence senior analyst Nathan Dean gives his insights into what’s been happening and what’s coming up in the nooks and crannies of government and markets.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump’s Call to Cut Earnings Reports Likely to Get SEC Attention

author: Nick Wadhams
description: President Donald Trump said the US struck a second vessel ferrying drugs from Venezuela, showing his determination to proceed with an aggressive strategy that’s ratcheted up tensions with the country and prompted questions about its legality.
title: US Hit Second Boat Carrying Drugs From Venezuela, Trump Says

author: Erik Wasson
description: House Republicans intend to bolster lawmaker security as part of a must-pass spending bill following the assassination of the conservative political activist Charlie Kirk last week.
title: US Lawmakers Move to Boost Personal Security After Kirk Killing

author: Molly Smith
description: The Bureau of Labor Statistics is hiring price collectors for a key inflation metric that’s increasingly relying on a statistical guessing method to compensate for lost staff.
title: BLS Offers $25 an Hour to Be a Part-Time CPI Price Collector

author: Leah Nylen
description: Allowing President Donald Trump to remove independent agency members undermines the legal basis for the independence of the Federal Reserve, lawyers for the Federal Trade Commission’s sole remaining Democrat told the US Supreme Court Monday.
title: Fate of Fed Intertwined With FTC Democrat, Supreme Court Told

author: Bob Van Voris
description: Maurene Comey, a longtime Manhattan federal prosecutor and the daughter of former FBI director James Comey, sued the Justice Department and the White House over her abrupt firing in July.
title: Comey’s Daughter Sues DOJ Over Firing as Federal Prosecutor

author: Leah Nylen
description: Google considered selling off parts of its ad tech business to resolve antitrust concerns in Europe and the US, a lawyer for the company said Monday, but a Justice Department proposal to force the sale of its advertising exchange goes much further.
title: Google Ad Tech Sale Offer Fell Far Short of Breakup DOJ Seeks

author: Kate Sullivan, Catherine Lucey
description: US President Donald Trump expects to announce economic deals totaling more than $10 billion during his trip this week to the United Kingdom, senior US officials said Monday.
title: Trump to Unveil Over $10 Billion in Economic Deals on UK Visit

author: Alessandra Migliaccio, Donato Paolo Mancini, Sonia Sirletti
description: Giorgia Meloni’s government is working on a preliminary plan to raise an extra €1.5 billion ($1.8 billion) from Italian lenders in 2027 by postponing their tax deductions, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Italy Is Drafting Plans to Raise €1.5 Billion More From Banks

author: Matthew Malinowski, Ivana Bargues
description: Chile’s government will keep a tight rein on spending in 2026, raising fiscal expenditure by less than in previous years even as the nation heads to the polls in November, the new finance minister said.
title: Chile Finance Minister Nicolas Grau Vows Limited Spending Increase in 2026 Budget

author: Jim Wyss
description: Haiti is bolstering its defenses near the capital after a gang rampage reportedly left at least 40 people dead, underscoring calls by the US and the international community to overhaul security in the troubled nation.
title: Haiti, US Condemn ‘Vile’ Attack That Killed 40 North of Capital

author: Joe Mayes
description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer said he wasn’t aware of the contents of emails from Peter Mandelson to disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein before publicly backing his then-US ambassador in the House of Commons.
title: Starmer Denies Knowing Epstein Emails When He Backed Mandelson

author: Daniel Flatley
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said the threat of allowing the social media app TikTok to go dark in the US was what ultimately sealed a framework deal in Madrid that would see the American iteration of the platform enter US hands — severing connections with its Chinese parent company ByteDance.
title: Bessent Says Trump’s Threat of TikTok Shutdown Delivered Deal

author: Galit Altstein, Alisa Odenheimer
description: Israel will need to be more self-sufficient as the nation becomes increasingly isolated over the war in Gaza, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said, in rare public comments about the impact of the conflict on the country’s international standing.
title: Israel Must Adapt Economy to International Isolation, PM Says

author: Swati Pandey
description: Australia is confident its wide-ranging security agreement with the US and UK will push ahead despite a Pentagon review, people familiar with the matter said, with Canberra recently announcing at least $9 billion in related defense investments.
title: Australia Confident Aukus Defense Pact Will Survive US Review

author: Alex Wickham
description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer has suffered a third forced departure from his government in less than two weeks as one of his senior advisers resigned amid media allegations about his past conduct.
title: Starmer Strategy Chief Quits in Fresh Blow to UK Prime Minister

author: Chris Reiter, Kamil Kowalcze
description: When Elon Musk posted on X in 2024 that the only thing that could “save Germany” was the AfD, he was embracing a political force that has moved steadily to the far right since it was founded in 2013.
title: How the AfD Became Germany’s Main Opposition Party

author: Jonathan Tirone
description: Iran’s top nuclear official warned of chaos if diplomats convened by the United Nations atomic watchdog block a motion to censure Israeli and US military attacks on the Islamic Republic in June.
title: Iran Warns of Chaos If Countries Refuse to Censure US and Israel

author: Eric Martin
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio will visit Qatar in a show of support after an Israeli missile strike last week, a senior State Department official said.
title: Rubio Set to Visit Qatar After Affirming US Support for Israel

author: Lauren Dezenski
description: President Donald Trump suggested there could be financial consequences over New York Governor Kathy Hochul’s endorsement of Democratic nominee Zohran Mamdani in the New York City mayor’s race.
title: New York Governor Backs Mamdani, Triggers Trump Funding Threat

author: Eric Martin
description: US President Donald Trump’s top diplomat refrained from criticizing Israel over its missile strike on Qatar last week, and said the priority is to make sure Hamas surrenders and disarms to end the war in Gaza.
title: Rubio Affirms US Support for Israeli Efforts to Eliminate Hamas

author: Skylar Woodhouse, Daniel Flatley
description: President Donald Trump said he would speak on Friday with Chinese leader Xi Jinping, following talks between negotiators from the world’s two largest economies in recent days that resulted in a framework deal to keep ByteDance Ltd.’s TikTok app running in the US.
title: Trump to Speak to Xi Friday With TikTok Deal Framework Reached

author: Alberto Nardelli, Zoltan Simon, Ewa Krukowska
description: The European Union is weighing sanctions on companies in India and China that are enabling Russia’s oil trade as part of an upcoming package of fresh restrictions, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: EU Grapples With How to Navigate Trump’s Demands on Russian Oil

author: Lauren Dezenski, Lydia Beyoud
description: President Donald Trump said companies should not be forced to deliver earnings reports on a quarterly basis, saying he preferred a six-month schedule he cast as saving businesses time and money.
title: Trump Says Companies Should Report Earnings Every Six Months

author: Sherry Su, Jack Wittels
description: At least two tankers have completed loadings at Russia’s Primorsk, showing that the Baltic Sea port has resumed operations in the aftermath of Friday’s drone attacks on the facility by Ukraine.
title: Russia’s Primorsk Port Resumes Oil Loadings After Drone Attacks

author: Shruti Srivastava, Preeti Soni
description: A team of US officials will reach India’s capital New Delhi on Monday night for discussions on a trade deal, indicating the two nations are moving closer to resolve differences.
title: US Officials to Reach India Monday For Trade Talks

author: Lucy White, William Standring
description: Nigel Farage has announced that a Conservative member of Parliament, Danny Kruger, defected to his Reform UK party on Monday, the latest in a string of defections from the government’s official opposition.
title: Conservative Danny Kruger Defects to Nigel Farage’s Reform UK

author: Flavia Krause-Jackson
description: The risk is that policy differences with the US are merely glossed over without resolving anything.
title: Trump’s Royal Welcome Puts UK’s Starmer in a Bind

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: Swiss lawmakers will on Monday vote on a second attempt to delay new rules for bank capital quality which are set to lift UBS Group AG’s capital requirements by some $3 billion.
title: Swiss Upper House to Vote on $3 Billion UBS Capital Measures

author: Josh Xiao
description: Pakistani President Asif Ali Zardari visited the defense company whose jet fighters were involved in a conflict between India and Pakistan this year, underscoring growing security ties with Beijing.
title: Pakistan President Visits Chinese Jet Maker as Defense Ties Grow

author: Norman Harsono, Grace Sihombing
description: Indonesia will add 16 trillion rupiah ($989 million) in stimulus this year to maintain growth in Southeast Asia’s largest economy.
title: Indonesia Adds $1 Billion in Rice Aid, Tax Breaks to Spur Growth

author: Firat Kozok, Beril Akman
description: A Turkish court adjourned a case questioning the legitimacy of the main opposition’s leadership, spurring a rally in lira assets.
title: Turkish Assets Rally as Court Adjourns Key Opposition Case

author: Maciej Martewicz
description: Poland’s top diplomat said he’ll press his Chinese counterpart to lean on Russia to cease “a hybrid operation” on the European Union member state’s eastern border, which led to a shutdown of Beijing’s key trade route to Europe.
title: Poland Will Seek China’s Help to Curb Migrant Crisis on Border

author: Yuan Gao, Jessica Sui
description: China ruled that Nvidia Corp. violated anti-monopoly laws with a high-profile 2020 deal, ratcheting up the pressure on Washington during sensitive trade negotiations.
title: China Finds Nvidia Violated Antitrust Law in Chip Deal Probe

author: Matthew Hill, Nduka Orjinmo
description: Islamic State and al-Qaeda are gaining ground in Africa as they retreat elsewhere, cementing the continent’s reputation as the global epicenter for jihadist attacks, using new technologies to boost numbers and expand territories.
title: Record Terror Surge in Africa Fueled by Starlink, Drones

author: Daniel Flatley, Daniel Basteiro, Olivia Tam
description: The US and China are “very close” to resolving the TikTok issue, US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent told reporters on Monday as trade discussions resumed in Madrid.
title: US Close to Resolving TikTok Issue With China, Bessent Says

author: Shruti Mahajan, Swati Gupta
description: India’s top court paused the implementation of certain provisions of a recently amended law governing Muslim-owned properties donated for religious and charitable purposes, months after the parliament cleared it.
title: India Top Court Pauses Key Parts of Disputed Muslim Property Law

author: Weilun Soon, Rakesh Sharma
description: A sanctioned tanker carrying Russian oil has neared an Indian port operated by Adani Group, and will likely be one of the last blacklisted vessels to unload at the conglomerate’s facilities after a ban took effect.
title: Sanctioned Oil Tanker Nears Adani Port Laden With Russian Crude

author: Adelaide Changole
description: South Africa’s top banking lobby group criticized the government’s withdrawal of proposed changes to the National Credit Act that were meant to help small firms secure loans.
title: South Africa Banks Pan Minister’s U-Turn on Credit-Law Changes

author: Swati Gupta
description: The son of Nepal’s richest tycoon said last week’s protesters had valid grievances, days after young demonstrators torched government buildings and homes of the wealthy in the Himalayan nation.
title: Nepal Tycoon’s Son Backs Protesters After Homes of Elites Burned

author: Beril Akman, Tugce Ozsoy
description: A political standoff in Turkey may reach a climax on Monday, when a court ruling threatens the existence of the main opposition party — and the future of democracy in the country of 85 million people.
title: Here’s How a Crucial Court Case in Turkey Will Impact Markets

author: Ellen Milligan
description: As soon as Donald Trump and Keir Starmer spoke for the first time last year, the nature of the US president’s affinity for Britain was clear.
title: Trump’s Love of UK Royalty Is Starmer’s Best Hope of Making Ties Special Again

author: Ditas B Lopez, Neil Jerome Morales
description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said no one will be spared, including his relatives and allies, in the government’s probe on the misuse of public funds for flood control projects and threw his support behind protests against corruption.
title: Marcos Vows to Spare No One in Corruption Probe on Flood Projects, Supports Protests

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: The US, South Korea and Japan held their first joint multi-domain drills since Presidents Donald Trump and Lee Jae Myung took office, drawing threats of “counteraction” from North Korea against what it labeled a war rehearsal.
title: US Holds Drills With Asian Allies, Drawing North Korea’s Rebuke
